content.2: A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up
content.3: A time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up;
content.4: A time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance;
content.5: A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;
content.6: A time to get, and a time to lose; a time to keep, and a time to cast away;
content.7: A time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;
content.8: A time to love, and a time to hate; a time of war, and a time of peace.
content.9: What profit hath he that worketh in that wherein he laboureth?
content.10: I have seen the travail, which God hath given to the sons of men to be exercised in it.
content.13: And also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy the good of all his labour, it
content.14: I know that, whatsoever God doeth, it shall be for ever: nothing can be put to it, nor any thing taken from it: and God doeth
content.15: That which hath been is now; and that which is to be hath already been; and God requireth that which is past.
content.16: And moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment,
content.17: I said in mine heart, God shall judge the righteous and the wicked: for
content.18: I said in mine heart concerning the estate of the sons of men, that God might manifest them, and that they might see that they themselves are beasts.
content.19: For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth, so dieth the other; yea, they have all one breath; so that a man hath no preeminence above a beast: for all
content.20: All go unto one place; all are of the dust, and all turn to dust again.
content.21: Who knoweth the spirit of man that goeth upward, and the spirit of the beast that goeth downward to the earth?
